root.message: The ADJUSTMENT field for indicator 3-2-1, translated into en
root.data: Direct estimates from survey data are adjusted in high prevalence HIV settings for under-reporting of under-five mortality due to ‘missing mothers,’ i.e. women who have died from HIV/AIDS and cannot report on the mortality experience of their children. Furthermore, UN IGME estimates are also adjusted to capture rapidly changing mortality rates due to HIV/AIDS and crises/disasters that are not well captured in survey data.
